Class: CheckInput

CheckInput(definition, options)

Creates a new JSON Schema validation class Checks a data object according a JSON Schema. Many thanks to epoberezkin/JSON-Schema-Test-Suite for providing a cool test suite. I use it to check my implementation This is not (yet) a full implementation. The following tests does not run yet: remote-refs (neither local nor remote) unicode-code-points (EmacsScript length is used to get the lengt of a string) propertyNames definitions

Constructor

new CheckInput(definition, options)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
definition Any

JSON schema definition
options Object

schema validation options

Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
deepUnique boolean <optional>
 true

if true, the content is checked deeply. For example different objects with the same
stringToNumber boolean <optional>
 false

if true, strings containing numbers are automatically converted
Source:
  • checkinput.js, line 61
Example
check = new CheckInput({
  type: 'object',
  properties: {
      topic: { type: 'string' },
      value: { type: 'string' },
  },
  required: ['topic', 'value']
})
// returns true, as the parameter fits to the descriptions
check.validate({ topic: '/a/b', value: 'on' })

// returns false and fills the error message
// check.message is { topic: 'missing property topic', value: 'missing property value' }
check.validate ( {} )

// Throws an Error, as the validation does not fits to the description
check.throwOnValidationError({ topic: '/a/b' })

// Prints the error message
console.log(check.messages)

Members

messages

Gets the list of error messages
